content: @Grahame Grieve (and @Harold Solbrig, @Eric Prud'hommeaux and @Claude Nanjo ), I notice that with the re-organization of the FHIR spec into Level 1, Level 2, etc., the Linked Data introduction seems to have disappeared: http://build.fhir.org/linked-data-module.html . The FHIR Overview/Roadmap page at http://build.fhir.org/overview.html still lists the Linked Data module, but the link to it now goes to the Exchange module at https://build.fhir.org/exchange-module.html , which doesn't mention it. I think it is helpful to somewhere provide an introduction to the Linked Data material/concepts, so I am wondering where you think it should now go. One idea might be to group it with the Clinical Reasoning module at http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html , since a key motivation behind the use of RDF is to support reasoning. Thoughts?
hmm. we moved things around but we didn't intend for that content to actually disappear... I'll chase it down when I get a chance
